content.json: ## View Microsoft Sentinel Incidents and details from any selected Workspaces

parameters.name: region
parameters.label: ðŸŒ Region
parameters.query:
Resources 
//| where type =~ "microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces"
| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
| where name has "SecurityInsights"
| summarize WorkspaceCount = count(name) by location
| order by location asc
| project value=location, display=strcat(location,'(',WorkspaceCount,')')

parameters.name: Subscription
parameters.label: â˜ï¸ Subscription
parameters.query:
resources
| where '*' in ({region}) or location in ({region})
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| distinct subscriptionId, location
| summarize by value = strcat("/subscriptions/", subscriptionId), label = subscriptionId
| order by value asc

parameters.name: Workspace
parameters.label: ðŸ—‚ï¸ Workspace
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| extend customerID = trim(' ', tostring(properties.customerId))
| project id, customerID, name=tolower(name)
|join 
(
	resources
	// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
	| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
	| where name has "SecurityInsights"
	| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
	| project name=tolower(s_workspace)
) on name
| project tolower(id), customerID, name

parameters.name: WorkspaceIDguid
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| extend customerID = trim(' ', tostring(properties.customerId))
| project '{Workspace:name}', name, customerID
| where '{Workspace:name}' has name
//| project customerID, name
// join two columns, seperate with a ":"; ARG, will comma seperate each row by default
| project strcat(customerID,":",name)

parameters.name: Product
parameters.label: Product Name
parameters.description: Filter on All or a named Product
parameters.query:
SecurityIncident
| extend productName_ = tostring(parse_json(tostring(AdditionalData.alertProductNames))[0])
| extend value = 
    case(productName_ =='Microsoft Cloud App Security','Microsoft Defender for Cloud App',
         productName_ == 'Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection','Microsoft Defender for Endpoint(ATP)',
         productName_ =='Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection','Microsoft Defender for Endpoint',
         productName_ =='Office 365 Advanced Threat Protection','Microsoft Defender for Office 365',
         productName_ =='Azure Advanced Threat Protection','Microsoft Defender for Identity',
         productName_ =='Azure Sentinel','Microsoft Sentinel',
         productName_ =='Azure Sentinel','Microsoft Sentinel',
         // else
         productName_)
| summarize by display=productName_, value
| order by value asc

parameters.name: resourceGroup
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
//| where name ==  "{Workspace:label}" 
| project resourceGroup

parameters.name: Owner
parameters.description: Filter on All or a named Owner assigned to an Incident
parameters.query:
SecurityIncident
| extend owner = tostring(Owner.assignedTo) 
| summarize Count=count(IncidentNumber) by Owner= case(owner=="", "Unassigned",owner)
| project Value = Owner, Label = strcat(Owner, ": ", Count)

content.json:
## Sentinel Central
### Change Log
Use this report to view Incident and Alert data across many workspaces (works with Azure Lighthouse)


|Version|Description|
|---|---|
|v1.2| View Alerts from multiple workspaces (Azure Lighhouse compatiable)|
|v1.3| MSSP release |
|v1.4| Add Workspace info |
|v1.5| Add Workspace info |
|v2.0| Multi workspace hunting. per Region selection from main drop down. |
|v2.1| Addition of Workspace and Table specific retention. |
|v2.2| Improve Hunting Tab and lookup the Workspace id automatically. Also add Table filtering in the **Retention** Tab, using the method from Sean Stark from Archive and Basic logs workbook|
|v2.2.1| Directory and Azure Lighthouse info added. |
|v2.3.0| SKU info added in [Ingestion] tab, and Content Hub info added from within the [Tables] tab. |

## Sentinel Central Help
#### Data sources: REST api, SentinelIncident and SecurityAlert Tables

## Incident Overview: 
Use this report to view Incident (and Alert data) across many workspaces, this works with Azure Lighthouse and across any subscription you have access to. The Workbook is not intended to replace the Multiple Incidents across Workspace view/feature in the Azure Sentinel UI, it's just a way of seeing the data in a different way.
- Workspaces not linked to Azure Sentinel will not be shown.

## Hunting
This option allows you to use your own KQL (which you can write within the page, or copy from an example or existing query). This will run against *any* of the Workspaces you have selected in the parameters (local or via Azure Lighthouse), please remember the more Workspaces and time range selected, the slower the results.
- Use case, this allows you to enter a simple KQL query that doesnâ€™t need the prefix of	workspace("my workspace name").my table name 

e.g. workspace(Demo").Usage | limit 10

or 

//Example query 
SecurityIncident
| summarize High = countif(Severity =="High"), Medium = countif(Severity =="Medium"), MyIncidents=make_set(IncidentNumber ) by WorkspaceId=TenantId

##### Note:
In your query it maybe useful to have the workspace ID returned, to do this you get the data from the TenantID column, as this name can be confusing we suggest you re-map it to WorkspaceID.
e.g.
â€¢	SecurityIncident | summarize count() by WorkspaceId=TenantId

## Query Packs
If you are using Query Packs, use this Tab to open one (from any Resource Group), you can then click on a Query Pack and then on an individual query to run it. 

- Use case, storing queries this way enables you to share them and secure them (ARM and RBAC), this methods allows you to stay within the workbook to find and execute your queries.
## Saved Searches
Any Saved Searches from a selected Workspace can be run from this tab. 

- Use Case, you can see (if you have read rights) saved searches in a selected Workspace and click to run them. Much like the Query Pack method above.

## Retention
Workspace and Table specific retention can be viewed in this tab.

- Use Case, you can see (if you have read rights) the same or different level retention set on a table in a selected Workspace.

content.query:
SecurityIncident
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
// end of get workspace name section
| summarize count(IncidentName) by   ["Workspace"] = workSpacename
content.title: Count of Security Incidents for selected {$rowCount} Workspaces

content.query:
ManagedServicesResources
| extend managed_  = tostring(properties.registrationDefinition.properties.manageeTenantName)
| extend managed2_ = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(properties.manageeTenantName))
| extend Directory = iif(isempty(managed_),managed2_, managed_)
| project ManagedBy=properties.registrationDefinition.properties.registrationDefinitionName, managed_, subscriptionId, resourceGroup
| where isnotempty( managed_)
| summarize count() by tostring(ManagedBy), tostring(managed_), subscriptionId, resourceGroup
| project Directory= managed_, ManagedBy, subscriptionId, resourceGroup, AzureLighthouse='Yes'
| join kind=fullouter 
(
	resources
	// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
	| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
	| where name has "SecurityInsights"
	| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
	| project workspaceName=tolower(s_workspace), location, subscriptionId, AzureLighthouse='No'
) on subscriptionId
| order by ['AzureLighthouse'] asc
| extend AzureLighthouse = iif(isempty(AzureLighthouse),AzureLighthouse1,AzureLighthouse)
| extend subscriptionId = iif(isempty(subscriptionId),subscriptionId1,subscriptionId)

items.name: query - ARG to find Azure Lighthouse

content.query:
SecurityIncident
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
// end of get workspace name section
| summarize High=  countif(Severity=="High"),
            Medium=countif(Severity=="Medium"),
            Low   =countif(Severity=="Low"), 
            Informational=countif(Severity=="Informational"),
            Last_record =  datetime_diff("second", now(), max(TimeGenerated)),
            Total  = count()
            by workSpacename
| join
(
SecurityIncident
// mean time to triage Section
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
// end of get workspace name section
//| where FirstModifiedTime  >= {TimeRange:start} and FirstModifiedTime  <= {TimeRange:end}
| extend Owner = todynamic(Owner.assignedTo) 
| where Owner in ({Owner}) or '{Owner:label}' ==  "All"
| extend Product = todynamic((parse_json(tostring(AdditionalData.alertProductNames))[0])) 
| where Product in ({Product}) or '{Product:label}' ==  "All"
| summarize arg_max(LastModifiedTime,*) by IncidentNumber 
| extend TimeToTriage =  (FirstModifiedTime - CreatedTime)/1h
| summarize 50th_PercentileMeanTime=percentile(TimeToTriage, 50) by workSpacename
) on workSpacename
|project-away workSpacename1
| join
(
SecurityIncident
// mean time to close Section
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| extend iD = TenantId
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
// end of get workspace name section
//| where ClosedTime >= {TimeRange:start} and ClosedTime <= {TimeRange:end}
| extend Owner = todynamic(Owner.assignedTo) 
| where Owner in ({Owner}) or '{Owner:label}' ==  "All"
| extend Product = todynamic((parse_json(tostring(AdditionalData.alertProductNames))[0])) 
| where Product in ({Product}) or '{Product:label}' ==  "All"
| summarize arg_max(LastModifiedTime,*) by IncidentNumber 
| extend TimeToClosure =  (ClosedTime - CreatedTime)/1h
| summarize 50th_PercentileCloseTime=percentile(TimeToClosure, 50) by workSpacename
) on workSpacename
|project-away workSpacename1
| join
(
SecurityIncident
    // Incident Trend by Workspace
    // Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
    | extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
    | mv-expand stringtoSplit
    | where stringtoSplit has TenantId
    | extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
    | make-series IncidentTrend=count() on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step {TimeRange:grain} by workSpacename
) on workSpacename
|project-away workSpacename1, TimeGenerated
| order by Total desc
content.title: Security Incident summary for {$rowCount} Workspaces:  QueryTime {$queryTime}

content.title: Security Incident summary for {$rowCount} Workspaces:  QueryTime {$queryTime}

content.query:
resources
 | where type == "microsoft.insights/workbooks"
 | where properties.displayName has "Security operations efficiency" 
 //| where properties.displayName has '{exportworkSpacename}'
 //| project properties.displayName, id
 | project id, note='Please select the Subscription and Workpsace names again in the new blade'
 | limit 1
content.title: Open [Security Operations Efficiency] Workbook - if the Workbook exists locally?

formatOptions.linkLabel: Click to Open [Security operations efficiency] workbook

content.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| extend customerWorkspaceID = trim(' ', tostring(properties.customerId))
| project id, customerWorkspaceID, name=tolower(name), subscriptionId, tenantId
|join 
(
	resources
	// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
	| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
	| where name has "SecurityInsights"
	| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
	| project name=tolower(s_workspace), subscriptionId, location, properties, resourceGroup
) on name
| where name =~ '{exportworkSpacename}'
| project name, Open=tolower(id), tenantId, customerWorkspaceID,  subscriptionId, location, properties, resourceGroup
content.title: Workspace details - click on "name" for more details

formatOptions.linkLabel: Click to Open [Security operations efficiency] workbook

content.title: Tenant Details

content.query:
SecurityIncident
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
// end of get workspace name section
| where Status == 'Closed'
| order by LastModifiedTime 
| summarize count(), make_set(ClassificationComment) by workSpacename, Classification , ClassificationReason 
| evaluate pivot(Classification, sum(count_))
content.title: Incident Classification report

content.query:
SecurityIncident
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
// end of get workspace name section
| extend Tactics_ = tostring(parse_json(tostring(AdditionalData.tactics)))
| summarize  count()
            by workSpacename, Tactics_
| order by count_ desc
| evaluate pivot(Tactics_, sum(count_))
content.title: Incident Tactics report

content.query:
SecurityIncident
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
// end of get workspace name section
| extend Tactics_ = tostring(parse_json(tostring(AdditionalData.techniques)))
| summarize  count()
            by workSpacename, Tactics_
| order by count_ desc
| evaluate pivot(Tactics_, sum(count_))
content.title: Incident Techniques report, count {$rowCount}

content.query:
SecurityIncident
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mvexpand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
// end of get workspace name section
| summarize Total  = count()
            by workSpacename
content.title: Count of Security Incidents for selected Workspaces and Severity

resources
// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
| where name has "SecurityInsights"
| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
| summarize count() by location, s_workspace

content.query:
resources
// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
| where name has "SecurityInsights"
| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
| summarize count() by location, s_workspace
content.title: Sentinel Workspaces by Azure Region

parameters.name: getMapdata1
parameters.query:
extend a = parse_json('{exportMap1}')
| project  ['region']=a.regionName,  ['Incident Count']=a.legendValue
| limit 1

parameters.name: getMapdata2
parameters.query:
extend a = parse_json('{exportMap2}')
| project  ['region']=a.regionName,  ['Incident Count']=a.legendValue
| limit 1

parameters.name: getMapdata1_count
parameters.query:
extend a = parse_json('{exportMap1}')
| project  ['Incident Count']=a.legendValue
| limit 1

parameters.name: getMapdata2_count
parameters.query:
extend a = parse_json('{exportMap2}')
| project  ['Incident Count']=a.legendValue
| limit 1

content.json:
### Results from clicking on the Maps above
--------------

|Azure Region|Location|Incident Count|Workspace Counter|
|---|---|---|
| Sentinel Incident Count by Region| {getMapdata1}|{getMapdata1_count}||
| Sentinel Workspaces by Azure Region| {getMapdata2}||{getMapdata2_count}|

-----------

content.query:
SecurityIncident
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mvexpand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
// end of get workspace name section
| extend Tactics_ = tostring(parse_json(tostring(AdditionalData.tactics)))
| summarize  count()
            by workSpacename, Tactics_
| order by count_ desc
content.title: Count of Tactics for selected Workspaces

content.query:
SecurityIncident
| where TimeGenerated > startofday(ago(0d))
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
// end of get workspace name section
| extend productName_ = tostring(parse_json(tostring(AdditionalData.alertProductNames))[0])
| where productName_ in ({Product}) or '{Product:label}' =="All"
| summarize count() by IncidentNumber, Title, productName_, Severity, ["Workspace"] = workSpacename, IncidentUrl
| order by Workspace asc , IncidentNumber desc
//| top 50 by ["Workspace"]
content.title: {$rowCount} Incidents in Workspaces today

content.json:
For further analysis I suggest you open the Azure Sentinel Incident Blade and _Investigate_ (use the hyper link provided in the table, if you have the correct RBAC).

Alternatively open the [_Investigation Insights_] or [_Incident Overview_] Workbooks for guided and deeper investigation.  Open Incident Overview from the Portal, _Investigation Insights_ can be opened to the right --->.

- You must have previoulsy SAVED these Workbooks in your workspace(s).  
- Investigation Insights requires release v1.2 or above (you may have to manually select the Workspace), for prior versions you will have to select the matching Incident Number as well. 
- For the Workbooks to be listed, they need "Investigation" in the name when you save them.

content.query:
resources
 | where type == "microsoft.insights/workbooks"
 | where properties.displayName has "Investigation" // or properties.displayName has "Incident"
 | where properties.displayName has '{Workspace_export}'
 | project properties.displayName, id,  {IncidentNumber}
content.title: Workspace Name: {Workspace_export}

content.json: ### Select a single workspace to see Incident level details

parameters.name: iWorkspace
parameters.label: Incident Workspace
parameters.query:
resources
// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
| where name has "SecurityInsights"
| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
| project name = s_workspace
| sort by name asc

parameters.name: iResourceGroup
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| where tolower(name) == "{iWorkspace}"
| project resourceGroup

content.query:
SecurityIncident
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
// end of workspace validation, now match workspace to the selected parameter
| where tolower(workSpacename) == tolower('{iWorkspace}')
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by tostring(IncidentNumber)
| extend Alerts = extract("\\[(.*?)\\]", 1, tostring(AlertIds))
| extend productName_ = tostring(parse_json(tostring(AdditionalData.alertProductNames))[0])
| where productName_ in ({Product}) or '{Product:label}' =="All"
| mv-expand AlertIds to typeof(string)
| join 
(
    SecurityAlert
    | extend AlertEntities = parse_json(Entities)
    | mv-expand AlertEntities
) on $left.AlertIds == $right.SystemAlertId
| summarize AlertCount=dcount(AlertIds), entityList=make_set(tostring(AlertEntities.Type)) by IncidentNumber, Status, Severity, Title,  Alerts, IncidentUrl, Owner=tostring(Owner.userPrincipalName) , Tactics =tostring(AdditionalData.tactics), workSpacename, productName_
// set column order
| project workSpacename, IncidentNumber, Severity, Status, AlertCount,Owner, Title, entityList, Tactics, IncidentUrl, productName_
| order by IncidentNumber desc
content.title: Details for {iWorkspace} Workspace, count of: {$rowCount} Incidents during {TimeRange:label}
Hunting: Hunt across selected workspaces, using any KQL you paste or edit in this field.

parameters.name: queryTxt
parameters.description: Add  workspace identity e.g SecurityIncident | summarize count() by WorkspaceId=TenantId

content.query: {queryTxt}
content.title: Cross workspace Query results, rows: {$rowCount}, QueryTime: {$queryTime}.  Select a row for more details

content.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| extend customerWorkspaceID = trim(' ', tostring(properties.customerId))
| project id, customerWorkspaceID, name=tolower(name), subscriptionId, tenantId
|join 
(
	resources
	// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
	| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
	| where name has "SecurityInsights"
	| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
	| project name=tolower(s_workspace), subscriptionId, location, properties, resourceGroup
) on name
content.title: ARG - to hide

formatOptions.linkLabel: Click to Open [Security operations efficiency] workbook

resources

| project-away type, kind

parameters.name: Workspace
parameters.description: Lookup saved queries in any Azure Sentinel workspace
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| extend customerID = trim(' ', tostring(properties.customerId))
| project id, customerID, name=tolower(name)
|join 
(
	resources
	// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
	| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
	| where name has "SecurityInsights"
	| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
	| project name=tolower(s_workspace)
) on name
| project tolower(id), customerID, name

| extend customerID = trim(' ', tostring(properties.customerId))
| project id, customerID, name=tolower(name)
|join 
(
	resources
	// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
	| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
	| where name has "SecurityInsights"
	| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
	| project name=tolower(s_workspace)
) on name
| project tolower(id), customerID, name

content.query: {"version":"ARMEndpoint/1.0","data":null,"headers":[],"method":"GET","path":"/subscriptions/{Workspace:subscription}/resourceGroups/{Workspace:resourcegroup}/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/{Workspace:name}/Tables?api-version=2021-12-01-preview","urlParams":[],"batchDisabled":false,"transformers":[{"type":"jsonpath","settings":{"tablePath":"$.value[?({tableFilter})]","columns":[{"path":"name","columnid":"TableName"},{"path":"properties.retentionInDays","columnid":"RetentionInDays"},{"path":"properties.plan","columnid":"plan"},{"path":"properties.archiveRetentionInDays","columnid":"archiveRetentionInDays"}]}}]}
content.title: Table Count: {$rowCount}

content.query:
Usage
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *), size = sum(Quantity)  by DataType
| project
    ['Table'] = DataType,
    ['Table Size'] = size,
    IsBillable
| order by Table asc
content.title: Tables Found in the {WorkspaceName} workspace

content.title: {tableFilter}, Count: {$rowCount}
content.noDataMessage: It appears your workspace doesn't currently have any tables that support Basic Plans or there are not any archived tables.

content.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces"
//| where name in (' {Workspace:name} ')
| project name=tolower(name), workspaceRetention=properties.retentionInDays,
     Workspacesku=properties.sku.name,
     WorkspaceskuLevel=properties.sku.capacityReservationLevel,
     WorkspaceskulastUpdate= properties.sku.lastSkuUpdate,
     properties, tenantId
|join 
(
	resources
	// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
	| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
	| where name has "SecurityInsights"
	| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
	| project name=tolower(s_workspace),
     Sentinelsku=properties.sku.name,
     SentinelskuLevel=properties.sku.capacityReservationLevel,
     SentinelskulastUpdate= properties.sku.lastSkuUpdate
) on name
| project name, Workspacesku, WorkspaceskuLevel, WorkspaceskulastUpdate, a='{Workspace:name}', Sentinelsku, SentinelskuLevel, SentinelskulastUpdate, tenantId
| extend WorkspaceskuLevel = iif(isempty(WorkspaceskuLevel),0,WorkspaceskuLevel),
         SentinelskuLevel = iif(isempty(SentinelskuLevel),0,SentinelskuLevel)
| where a has name 
| project-away a
content.title: Workspace SKU details, count: {$rowCount}, click row for more insight

content.query:
Usage
| where IsBillable == True
| parse ResourceUri with * 'workspaces/' workspaceName_s
| where workspaceName_s == '{wsName}'
| summarize dataPerDay = sum(Quantity)/1000  by bin(TimeGenerated,1d), SentinelCT='{skuLevel}'
| extend higherCT = case(
                   dataPerDay < 100, 100,
                   dataPerDay > 100  and dataPerDay < 200, 200,
                   dataPerDay > 200  and dataPerDay < 300, 300,
                   dataPerDay > 300  and dataPerDay < 400, 400,
                   dataPerDay > 400  and dataPerDay < 500, 500,
                   dataPerDay > 500  and dataPerDay < 1000, 1000,
                   dataPerDay > 1000 and dataPerDay < 10000, 10000,
                   dataPerDay > 2000 and dataPerDay < 20000, 20000,
                   dataPerDay > 5000 and dataPerDay < 50000, 50000,
                   // else
                   0
                   )
//| extend lowerCT= (higherCT - 100)
content.title: Actual Data Volume and Commitment Tier.  Data from: {TimeRange:label}.

content.query:
Usage
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
| where IsBillable == true
| summarize GBytes=sum(Quantity)/1000 by workSpacename, bin(TimeGenerated,{TimeRange:grain})
content.title: Ingestion by Workspace for {TimeRange:label}

content.query:
Usage
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
| where IsBillable == True
| summarize GBytes=sum(Quantity)/1000 by workSpacename//, bin(TimeGenerated,{TimeRange:grain})
| top 10 by GBytes
content.title: Top 10 Workspaces by ingestion capacity

content.query:
Usage
// Only look at billable Tables
| where IsBillable == True
| summarize TotalBytes =round(sum(Quantity)) by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| summarize GBperday = round(avg(TotalBytes)/1000,2)
content.title: GB per Day, {TimeRange:label}

content.query:
Usage
// Only look at billable Tables
| where IsBillable == True
| summarize GBytes =round(sum(Quantity))/1000
content.title: GB Total {TimeRange:label}

content.query:
Usage
// Only look at billable Tables
| where TimeGenerated > endofmonth(ago(90d))
| where IsBillable == True
| summarize GBytes =round(sum(Quantity))/1000 by bin(TimeGenerated,30d)
content.title: Monthly GB Total {TimeRange:label}

content.query:
Usage
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
| summarize CountofTables=dcount(DataType) , TableName=make_set(DataType) by workSpacename
| order by CountofTables desc
content.title: Table count by Workspace, count: {$rowCount}, click row for Content Hub details

parameters.name: ws
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| extend customerID = trim(' ', tostring(properties.customerId))
| project id, customerID, name=tolower(name)
|join 
(
resources
	// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
	| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
	| where name has "SecurityInsights"
	| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
	| project name=tolower(s_workspace), id, subscriptionId, resourceGroup
    | where name == tolower('{workSpacename}')
) on name
| project tolower(id), customerID, name

content.title: Solution Count: {$rowCount}, click row to read HTML description  {ws} {workSpacename}

content.title: Solution Count: {$rowCount}, click row to read HTML description

items.name: query - merged view to show Update available

content.query:
Usage
// Get the Workspace Name(s) from a parameter
| extend stringtoSplit = split("{WorkspaceIDguid}",",")
| mv-expand stringtoSplit
| where stringtoSplit has TenantId
| extend workSpacename = trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(split(stringtoSplit,":").[1]))
| summarize by DataType, workSpacename, IsBillable
| join ( Usage | make-series Trend=count() on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step {TimeRange:grain} by DataType ) on DataType
content.title: Table usage trend, count: {$rowCount}

parameters.name: ws
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| extend customerID = trim(' ', tostring(properties.customerId))
| project id, customerID, name=tolower(name)
|join 
(
	resources
	// Just show Workspaces that have Sentinel enabled
	| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
	| where name has "SecurityInsights"
	| parse name with * '(' s_workspace ')'*
	| project name=tolower(s_workspace)
) on name
| project tolower(id), tostring(name), a='{Workspace:name}'
| where a has name
